option.value: {"A:/prog avan/RpG-Oaxacones-Corp":"{\"/Rpg 0.3/gui/buttons/HoverButtonUI.java\":\"This file contains a single class:\\n\\n`HoverButtonUI`: A custom Swing button UI that provides a hover effect and a customized appearance for buttons.\\n\\nThe file also contains the following functions:\\n\\n`installDefaults(AbstractButton b)`: Initializes the button\\u0027s images and configures its visual and behavioral properties.\\n\\n`getPreferredSize(JComponent c)`: Returns the preferred size of the button.\\n\\n`getMaximumSize(JComponent c)`: Returns the maximum size of the button, which is the same as the preferred size.\\n\\n`getMinimumSize(JComponent c)`: Returns the minimum size of the button, which is the same as the preferred size.\\n\\n`initParts()`: Initializes the images used for the button\\u0027s normal and hover states.\\n\\n`paint(Graphics g, JComponent c)`: Draws the button on the graphics component, using different images depending on the button\\u0027s state (hover or normal).\\n\\n`drawButtonParts(Graphics2D g2d, ImageIcon[] parts)`: Draws the button\\u0027s parts using the provided images.\",\"/Rpg 0.3/items/miscs/MedicalBrew.java\":\"This file defines a class called `MedicalBrew` that extends the `Misc` class. The `MedicalBrew` class represents a consumable item that restores a fixed amount of health to the player.\\n\\n`MedicalBrew`: A class that represents a consumable item that restores a fixed amount of health to the player.\\n\\n`MedicalBrew()`: A constructor that initializes the `MedicalBrew` object with a name, description, and a fixed healing amount.\",\"/Rpg 0.3/gui/panels/MiddlePanel.java\":\"This file contains a single class:\\n\\n`MiddlePanel`: This class represents the central panel of the user interface and is responsible for configuring its background and size.\\n\\nThe file also contains the following functions:\\n\\n`init()`: This function initializes the components of the central panel, sets the background image, and establishes the dimensions and border of the panel according to predefined configurations.\",\"/Rpg 0.3/gui/labels/events/ShowStatusEvent.java\":\"`ShowStatusEvent`: This class extends `MouseAdapter` and is responsible for handling the event when a user clicks on a specific component, which then sets the visibility of the `StatusFrame` to true.\\n\\n`mouseClicked(MouseEvent e)`: This method is overridden from the `MouseAdapter` class and is called when the user clicks on a specific component. It sets the visibility of the `StatusFrame` to true.\",\"/Rpg 0.3/gui/ui/GameLabelUI.java\":\"This file contains a single class, `GameLabelUI`, which extends the `BasicLabelUI` class from the Swing library. The `GameLabelUI` class is responsible for rendering a custom label component with an image icon and text.\\n\\n`GameLabelUI`: A custom Swing label UI that renders a label with an image icon and text.\\n\\n`installDefaults(JLabel c)`: Sets the label to be non-opaque and removes the border.\\n\\n`paint(Graphics g, JComponent c)`: Draws the label\\u0027s image icon and text, with the text centered horizontally.\\n\\n`layout(JLabel label, FontMetrics fm, int width, int height)`: Calculates the layout of the label\\u0027s text and icon within the available space.\",\"/Rpg 0.3/entities/enemy/Enemys/Spinosaurus.java\":\"`Spinosaurus`: This class represents a specific enemy, the Spinosaurus, in the game, extending the `Enemy` class and customizing the Spinosaurus\\u0027s statistics and attack behavior.\\n\\n`attack(Player player)`: This method implements the attack behavior of the Spinosaurus, where it attacks the player with its powerful jaws and deals damage.\\n\\n`getLoot()`: This method is currently empty, but it is intended to handle the loot that the Spinosaurus drops when defeated.\\n\\n`initCharacter()`: This method is currently empty, but it is intended to initialize the character\\u0027s properties.\\n\\n`attack(GameCharacter enemy)`: This method is currently empty, but it is intended to implement the attack behavior of the Spinosaurus against other game characters.\\n\\n`getSprite()`: This method returns the sprite (image) of the Spinosaurus to be used in the game.\",\"/Rpg 0.3/inventory/Inventory.java\":\"This file defines an `Inventory` class that manages a collection of `Item` objects, including `Armor` and `Misc` items. The class provides methods to add, remove, and retrieve items, as well as to manage the inventory\\u0027s capacity and check its status.\\n\\n`Inventory`: A class that represents an inventory of items, with methods to manage the inventory\\u0027s contents and capacity.\\n\\n`addItem(Item item)`: Adds an item to the inventory, throwing an `InventoryFullException` if the inventory is full.\\n`removeItem(Item item)`: Removes an item from the inventory.\\n`getItem(int index)`: Retrieves an item from the inventory by its index.\\n`getItem(Item item)`: Retrieves an item from the inventory by its name, throwing an `ItemNotFoundException` if the item is not found.\\n`getItemCount()`: Returns the number of items in the inventory.\\n`isFull()`: Checks if the inventory is full.\\n`isEmpty()`: Checks if the inventory is empty.\\n`clear()`: Removes all items from the inventory.\\n`increaseCapacity(int amount)`: Increases the inventory\\u0027s capacity by the specified amount.\\n`getArmors()`: Returns a list of all `Armor` items in the inventory.\\n`getMiscs()`: Returns a list of all `Misc` items in the inventory.\\n`getItems()`: Returns a list of all items in the inventory.\",\"/Rpg 0.3/gui/buttons/ExitButton.java\":\"`ExitButton`: A class that extends `BaseButton` and provides an \\\"Exit\\\" button functionality.\\n\\n`ExitButton()`: A constructor that initializes the `ExitButton` with the label \\\"Salir\\\" and adds an action listener that exits the application when the button is clicked.\",\"/Rpg 0.3/gui/buttons/LoadFileButton.java\":\"`LoadFileButton`: A class that extends `NewFileButton` and represents a button to load a saved game.\\n\\n`LoadFileButton(int slot, StartWindow startWindow)`: A constructor that initializes the \\\"Load Game\\\" button, sets its text, removes the default action listener, and adds a new action listener for loading the game.\\n\\nThis file defines a class called `LoadFileButton` that extends the `NewFileButton` class. The `LoadFileButton` class represents a button that allows the user to load a saved game. The constructor of the `LoadFileButton` class sets the text of the button to \\\"Cargar Partida\\\" (Load Game in Spanish) and adds a new action listener that handles the event of loading the game.\",\"/Rpg 0.3/items/armaduras/Fur.java\":\"This file defines a single abstract class:\\n\\n`Fur`: This class represents a specific type of armor made of fur, and it extends the `Armor` class, inheriting its properties and methods.\\n\\nThe file does not contain any functions, but the constructor of the `Fur` class is defined, which calls the constructor of the `Armor` class with specific values for the name and defense bonus of the armor.\",\"/Rpg 0.3/gui/buttons/SkillPanelButton.java\":\"This file contains a single class:\\n\\n`SkillPanelButton`: A button class that extends the `BaseButton` class and is used to represent a \\\"Skills\\\" button in the GUI.\\n\\nThe file does not contain any functions, but rather it defines a single class that represents a specific type of button in the GUI.\",\"/Rpg 0.3/items/miscs/CookedFishMeat.java\":\"This file defines a class `CookedFishMeat` that represents a type of miscellaneous item in a game, which can be used to restore a fixed amount of health when consumed by a player.\\n\\n`CookedFishMeat`: A class that represents a cooked fish meat item that can be used to restore a fixed amount of health.\\n\\n`CookedFishMeat()`: A constructor that initializes a `CookedFishMeat` object with a name, description, and a fixed healing amount.\",\"/Rpg 0.3/items/Item.java\":\"This file defines an abstract `Item` class that represents an item in a game or application. The class has several properties, such as name, description, price, and type, and provides methods to retrieve these properties. The class also includes a method to get an `ImageIcon` representation of the item\\u0027s icon.\\n\\n`Item`: An abstract class that represents an item in a game or application.\\n\\n`initItem()`: An abstract method that initializes the attributes of the current class and must be implemented by subclasses.\\n\\n`getName()`: Returns the name of the item.\\n\\n`getDescription()`: Returns the description of the item.\\n\\n`getPrice()`: Returns the price of the item.\\n\\n`getType()`: Returns the type of the item.\\n\\n`getIcon()`: Returns an `ImageIcon` representation of the item\\u0027s icon.\",\"/Rpg 0.3/gui/buttons/events/NewFileEvent.java\":\"This file contains the implementation of the `NewFileEvent` class, which is responsible for handling the user\\u0027s action when they create a new file.\\n\\n`NewFileEvent`: This class implements the `ActionListener` interface and is responsible for handling the user\\u0027s action when they create a new file.\\n\\n`actionPerformed`: This function is called when the user performs an action (e.g., clicks a button) that triggers the `NewFileEvent`. It creates a new `Player` object, saves it to the specified slot, and opens a new `MainWindow` instance with the created player.\",\"/Rpg 0.3/gui/buttons/NewFileButton.java\":\"This file contains a single class:\\n\\n`NewFileButton`: A button that creates a new player and starts a new game session.\\n\\nThe file also contains the following function:\\n\\n`NewFileButton(int slot, StartWindow startWindow)`: Constructs a new `NewFileButton` instance with the specified slot and `StartWindow` reference, and adds a `NewPlayerEvent` listener to the button.\",\"/Rpg 0.3/enums/WearType.java\":\"This file does not contain any classes or functions. It defines an enumeration called `WearType` that represents the different types of equipment a character can wear in a game or application. The enumeration includes the following values:\\n\\n`WearType`: An enumeration that defines the different types of equipment a character can wear, such as head, chest, legs, feet, hands, and weapon.\",\"/Rpg 0.3/gui/labels/IconLabel.java\":\"`IconLabel`: A custom JLabel class that displays an ImageIcon.\\n\\n`initComponents()`: Initializes the preferred size of the IconLabel based on the size of the ImageIcon.\\n\\nThis file defines a custom JLabel class called `IconLabel` that is used to display an `ImageIcon`. The class sets the preferred size of the label based on the size of the `ImageIcon` and uses a custom `GameLabelUI` to render the label.\",\"/Rpg 0.3/gui/panels/BottomPanel.java\":\"`BottomPanel`: A class that represents the bottom panel of the game, which is used to display buttons or other interactive components at the bottom of the interface.\\n\\n`init()`: Initializes the components of the bottom panel, sets the background image, dimensions, and border of the panel.\\n\\nThis file defines a class called `BottomPanel` that extends the `BackgroundPanel` class. The `BottomPanel` class is responsible for configuring the bottom panel of the game\\u0027s user interface, including setting the background image, dimensions, and border of the panel.\",\"/Rpg 0.3/entities/enemy/Enemys/Carnotaurus.java\":\"`Carnotaurus`: This class represents a specific enemy in the game, the Carnotaurus, which extends the `Enemy` class and customizes the statistics and attack behavior of the Carnotaurus.\\n\\n`attack(Player player)`: This method is an implementation of the `attack` method from the `Enemy` class, which prints a message and inflicts damage on the player.\\n\\n`getLoot()`: This method is an implementation of the `getLoot` method from the `Enemy` class, but it is currently empty.\\n\\n`initCharacter()`: This method is an implementation of the `initCharacter` method from the `Enemy` class, but it is currently empty.\\n\\n`attack(GameCharacter enemy)`: This method is an implementation of the `attack` method from the `Enemy` class, but it returns an empty string.\\n\\n`getSprite()`: This method returns the `ImageIcon` for the Carnotaurus sprite.\",\"/Rpg 0.3/utils/cache/ImageCache.java\":\"This file defines the `ImageCache` class, which manages a cache of images to avoid repeated loading from disk. It provides the following classes and functions:\\n\\n`ImageCache`: A class that manages a cache of images to avoid repeated loading from disk.\\n\\n`addImage(String name, String path)`: A static method that adds an image to the cache, loading it from the specified path if it\\u0027s not already in the cache.\\n\\n`getImage(String imageName)`: A static method that retrieves an image from the cache, returning `null` if the image is not found.\\n\\n`getImageIcon(String imageName)`: A static method that retrieves an `ImageIcon` from the cache, creating it from the cached image.\\n\\nThe file also defines a base path for the images and uses a `HashMap` to store the cached images.\",\"/Rpg 0.3/items/miscs/Misc.java\":\"This file contains a single abstract class `Misc` that represents a type of miscellaneous object in a game. The class extends the `Item` class and implements the `Serializable` interface, allowing the objects to be serialized.\\n\\n`Misc`: An abstract class that represents a type of miscellaneous object in a game, with properties for determining if the object is consumable, stackable, and the current and maximum quantity of the object.\\n\\n`use()`: An abstract method that defines the behavior when the object is used, which must be implemented by the derived classes.\\n\\n`isConsumable()`: A method that returns whether the object is consumable.\\n\\n`isStackable()`: A method that returns whether the object is stackable.\\n\\n`getQuantity()`: A method that returns the current quantity of the object.\\n\\n`increaseQuantity(int amount)`: A method that increases the quantity of the object by the specified amount, up to the maximum quantity.\\n\\n`decreaseQuantity(int amount)`: A method that decreases the quantity of the object by the specified amount, down to 0.\",\"/Rpg 0.3/items/weapons/Bow.java\":\"This file defines a Java class `Bow` that extends the `Weapon` class, representing a specific type of weapon, the bow.\\n\\n`Bow`: A class that represents a bow, a specific type of weapon.\\n\\n`Bow()`: The constructor for the `Bow` class, which calls the constructor of the parent `Weapon` class with the name \\\"Arco\\\" and a base damage value of 15.\",\"/Rpg 0.3/gui/ui/NameLabelUI.java\":\"This file contains a single class, `NameLabelUI`, which extends the `GameLabelUI` class and is responsible for rendering a label with a specific visual style, including a left, center, and right image component.\\n\\n`NameLabelUI`: A custom UI component that renders a label with a specific visual style, including a left, center, and right image component.\\n\\n`NameLabelUI()`: Initializes the `NameLabelUI` class by loading the necessary images from the `ImageCache` and setting up the default properties of the label.\\n\\n`installDefaults(JLabel c)`: Sets the default properties of the label, such as the font, color, alignment, and preferred size.\\n\\n`paint(Graphics g, JComponent c)`: Renders the label with the custom visual style, including the left, center, and right image components, and the text of the label.\",\"/Rpg 0.3/gui/windows/StartWindow.java\":\"This file contains the implementation of the `StartWindow` class, which represents the main window of a Java RPG game. The file also includes several helper functions and classes used to manage the game\\u0027s save files and user interface elements.\\n\\n`StartWindow`: The main class that represents the starting window of the Java RPG game.\\n\\n`main`: The entry point of the application, which creates a new instance of the `StartWindow` class.\\n\\n`StartWindow()`: The constructor that sets up the initial configuration of the starting window, including its size, title, and default close operation.\\n\\n`update()`: A method that updates the content of the save file slots, displaying the player\\u0027s name and level or indicating an empty slot.\\n\\n`createUIComponents()`: A method that initializes the various UI components used in the starting window, such as labels, buttons, and panels.\\n\\n`isFileEmpty(int)`: A helper method that checks if a save file for a given slot is empty.\",\"/Rpg 0.3/entities/GameCharacter.java\":\"`GameCharacter`: An abstract class that represents a game character with various stats and abilities.\\n\\n`initCharacter()`: An abstract method that initializes the character\\u0027s stats.\\n\\n`isAlive()`: Checks if the character is alive by verifying if their health stat is greater than 0.\\n\\n`attack(GameCharacter enemy)`: Allows the character to attack another game character, dealing damage based on their attack stat.\\n\\n`getName()`: Returns the name of the character.\\n\\n`getStats()`: Returns the character\\u0027s stats as a HashMap.\\n\\n`takeDamage(int damage)`: An abstract method that should be
